column4: seriously no one else is having issues with any external drives being recognized  in 9.10
run sudo fdisk -l and let me know if it sees it in there?
it does see it with fdisk -l
then you just need to mount it with like sudo mount -rw /dev/XXX /media/where you want OR you can use /etc/fstab if you want to keep it moounted all the time like after you reboot and all.
I usually don't let linux automatically manage my mounts for me.
it use to see the whatever drive that i plugged in now it never sees any i dont get it
sorry i'm not really sure what could be causing that.. hmmm
mount -rw /dev/sdb1 /mnt
that fix it?
pastebin what your fdisk -l says...
you may have to add -t <filesystem type>
paste me the output of sudo fdisk -l
do i paste in here or somewhere else
at pastebin.com
kk i see your post
whats the output of this mount -rw /dev/sdb2 /mnt ?
thats what your want not /dev/sdb1
that work?
now go to /mnt and your files on your flash drive will be there.
figure it out?
i'm not sure i don't really mess with plugin play (probably rebooting it will fix it)
actually rebooting doesnt fix it i've been trying to sort this out for about 4 days no jump drive ipod or anyting will work weird
hmm idk sorry perhaps its a setting somewhere that got messed up or something
